bug.author: jscriptcoder
bug.summary: Browser crashes after loading Keras model with LSTM layers
bug.description: Hi there, A month ago or so I reported an issue, <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/tfjs/issues/738>#738</denchmark-link> , which turned out to be a duplicate of <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/tfjs/issues/218>#218</denchmark-link> . Layer Dot seems to have been added to tfjs-layer in version 0.8.2, which is excellent news. Good job guys. This finally loads my model, but after a few seconds the browsers crashes. I get this warning on the console log: "" I'm using , in . The keras model trained can be found here: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/jscriptcoder/date-translator/tree/master/jupyter>https://github.com/jscriptcoder/date-translator/tree/master/jupyter</denchmark-link> , file, and the converted model is here: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/jscriptcoder/date-translator/tree/master/tfjsmodel>https://github.com/jscriptcoder/date-translator/tree/master/tfjsmodel</denchmark-link> . The Jupyter notebook with the training is here: <denchmark-link:https://bit.ly/2Oc14Ce>https://bit.ly/2Oc14Ce</denchmark-link> . I'm using Tensorflow 1.10.0 as backend and Keras 2.2.2. To convert the model I used Tensorflowjs 0.6.0. Thasnks a lot, Fran

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/jscriptcoder>@jscriptcoder</denchmark-link> Thanks for reporting this issue. I am able to reproduce issue, in both the browser and node.js (tfjs-node). We'll look into this bug.
